results.title: Fitness wins the game
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Exclusive Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Football, cricket, boxing, hurdling, throwing the discus, in fact any kind of sport requires hard training if one is to excel at them. This film shows both the actual sports, and how to train for them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Carter, Exclusive Films and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Fitness for Tennis - Stan Nicholes
results.brief_description: Hosted by Australia’s international tennis champion, Tony Roche (the man responsible for coaching Ivan Lendl on the restructuring of his game), this unique video gathers together some of the world’s tennis greats: Ivan Lendl, Martina Navratilova, Bjorn Borg, John McEnroe, Ken Rosewall, Pam Shriver, and others.

results.title: Fitness for living: how to get fit
results.creator_credit: Eric Horter and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: This film shows ways of getting fit and suggests that regular practice of specific exercises is the key to developing strength and endurance; that slow continuous exercise such as jogging or bicycling develops the heart and lungs; that weight training augments muscle strength. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Fishing fun
results.brief_description: Surf casting along the Atlantic Coast for bass; trout fishing in the Rockies; fishing for marlin off the Australian coast; tuna fishing in Nova Scotia.

results.title: Fishing across Canada
results.brief_description: Screen Magazine: Herring from the river: fishermen-farmers of the Gasperaux Valley in Nova Scotia catch herring upriver. Fish below the ice: Cree Indians of northern Manitoba fish in wintertime by stringing nets between holes in the ice. Home for young trout: to stock mountain lakes in the Canadian Rockies, fish are raised in hatcheries, the largest in Jasper National Park. Salmon on the run: on Canada’s west coast, commercial fishing vessels haul in huge catches. A glimpse of the of the multi-million-dollar salmon industry of Canada’s west coast.
results.description: Screen Magazine: Herring from the river: fishermen-farmers of the Gasperaux Valley in Nova Scotia catch herring upriver. results.title: Fisheries in Japan
results.creator_credit: E F V A and Iwanami
results.brief_description: Provides an aerial view of the islands of Japan and shows the main ocean currents and the types of fish found in them. Describes various methods of fishing and studies salmon hatcheries in some detail. Re-edited by the Education Foundation for Visual Aids (UK).
results.description: Provides an aerial view of the islands of Japan and shows the main ocean currents and the types of fish found in them. Describes various methods of fishing and studies salmon hatcheries in some detail. Re-edited by the Education Foundation for Visual Aids (UK).

results.title: Fish in farm dams
results.creator_credit: John Gacy and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the native warm water fish breeding program being carried out at the Island Fisheries Research Station, Narrandera, NSW. Also looks at the work being done by State Fisheries and the Water Resources Commission which benefits farmers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Gacy and New South Wales Film Corporation
